subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Stewart Cink’s fortunes turned quickly in a vicious wind that never went away. He made three straight birdies for a two-under 68 in the third round of the PODS Championship in Palm Harbor, Fla., before play was suspended because of darkness. Cink went from four shots behind to two shots ahead in a stretch of five holes, and despite a 30-mile-an-hour wind and 50-degree temperatures, he did not make a bogey until he was on the 18th hole. Cink was at five-under 208, two shots ahead of the former United States Open champion Geoff Ogilvy, who had a 69. The second-round leader Brandt Snedeker was three under and in the 16th fairway when play was stopped.
